items.content_html:
FF133 adds support for <dialog> elements to respond to HTMLElement events toggle and beforetoggle. This updates the docs.

Note, the events are fired for popups as well and the docs are popup centric, so part of the work is to update that to be generic.

Also the docs indicate that toggle (but not beforetoggle) is fired on the <details> element. A separate HTMLDetailsElement toggle event doc is specified and docs make it clear that this is different. It may have been at one point but it does not appear to be now - it behaves the same, and is defined only on HTMLElement in spec. There is also a planned change to update details to also support the beforetoggle. UPshot, this will delete that too.

Related docs work #36536
items.title: Ff133 dialog toggle beforetoggle events

items.content_html:
Description

This PR is part of improving the web/manifest docs and updates the categories, screenshots, and description pages:

  • Added "Syntax", "Values", and "Description" sections
  • Covered caveats from the spec
  • Added prose to the examples
  • Removed dir and lang from description page because they are not implemented

(Also fixed formatting in icons Syntax block)

Motivation

To ensure all sections have sufficient explanation, all info from spec is covered, and the manifest pages follow a similar template

Additional details

Spec: https://w3c.github.io/manifest-app-info/

Related issues and pull requests

Tracking issue: mdn/mdn#560
items.title: docs(manifest): Improvements to app store members

items.content_html:
FF132 adds Uint8Array methods for constructing and populating Uint8Array byte arrays with strings that are encoded in bas64 or hex, and similarly for creating a base64 or hex-encoded string from a Uint8Array.

This adds a release note. The corresponding docs will be added by #36387

Related docs can be tracked in #36547
items.title: FF133Relnote: Uint8Array .from/setFrom/toHex() and Base64() methods
add ::highlight() to pseudos

items.content_html:
Description

Bumps the strict_min_version to 58.0.

Motivation

Otherwise the AMO validation shows this error message:

Lowest supported "strict_min_version" is 58.0.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: fix(webextensions): bump strict_min_version to 58.0

items.content_html:
Description

This PR refreshes a few HTTP headers pages.

common changes:

  • Improve See also
  • Capitalize Yes/No in properties table
  • Normalize The HTTP **`Header-Name`** (request|response) header in first sentence
  • Add status text to HTTPStatus macros, e.g. {{HTTPStatus("406", "406 Not Acceptable")}}
  • Remove improper use of quotes in and around code
  • Avoid escaping angle brackets in directive names in favor of backticks:
- \<directive>
+ `<directive>`

Motivation

Keeping content up-to-date, fixing formatting, unifying writing conventions

TODO:

  • Bad BCD queries
items.title: chore(http): Refresh headers r-s

items.title: Note re exception from storage.managed.get

items.content_html:
Description

In Safari, list-style: none doesn't work to hide the <summary> marker. Instead you must use ::-webkit-details-marker to target the Shadow DOM and hide it with display: none.

Motivation

I needed to learn how to do this for my personal website, and it was hard to find a clear answer online. In particular, MDN seems to be the best resource for things like this, and it felt missing from this site.

Additional details

WebKit bug: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=157323

Related issues and pull requests

There's a PR to change this behavior in Safari, but it will at least be useful to have this documentation for supporting historical versions of the browser.

WebKit GitHub: WebKit/WebKit#34778
items.title: Add info about ::-webkit-details-marker in Safari

items.content_html:
‚Ä¶nique

Description

In Chrome 126, the behavior of the GPUQueue.submit() method has been updated to be correct as per spec ‚Äî the referenced command buffers must be unique.

This PR adds a line to state this in the parameter description, and a validation statement.

See https://developer.chrome.com/blog/new-in-webgpu-126#submitted_command_buffers_must_be_unique for the information source.

Motivation

Additional details

project issue: #36344

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add information to GPUQueue.submit() to say command buffers must be u‚Ä¶

items.content_html:
Description

I've corrected and improved/extended the contents of the using_media_queries article.

Motivation

The current documentation lists the inequality operator of greater than or equal to as =>. I've corrected this to >=.

I've further given some examples of the use of this and related inequality operators in media queries.

Lastly, I've clarrified the interpretation of media query lists under logic (logical disjunction), as well as the interpretation and usage of the and and or operators used within media queries.

Additional details

W3C - Syntax of Media Queries
W3C - Combining Media Features

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Improves the `css` `using_media_queries` content
